snippet: A social media editor at Thomson Reuters has been charged with helping Anonymous hack into The Los Angeles Times Web site, British talks on a new method to regulate the press have fallen through, and NBCUniversal News Group put a positive face...
abstract: A social media editor at Thomson Reuters has been charged with helping Anonymous hack into The Los Angeles Times Web site, British talks on a new method to regulate the press have fallen through, and NBCUniversal News Group put a positive face forward at its upfront.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Editor Charged With Hacking and Reform Talks in Britain Break Down
